Description and Justification: Widely adopted, many software tools exist for encoding and decoding. JPEG 2000 part 1 is considered an accepted format as per NARA Transfer Guidance.
Preferred Processing and Transformation: Adobe Photoshop; GNU Image Manipulation Program; IrfanView

Description and Justification: Often referred to as "JPEG," however JPEG is the encoding and JFIF is the file format. The JPEG File Interchange Format is well documented and well supported.
Preferred Processing and Transformation: Adobe Photoshop; GNU Image Manipulation Program; IrfanView

Description and Justification: Often referred to as "JPEG," however JPEG is the encoding and JFIF is the file format. The JPEG File Interchange Format is well documented and well supported.
Preferred Processing and Transformation: Adobe Photoshop; GNU Image Manipulation Program; IrfanView

Description and Justification: Often referred to as "JPEG," however JPEG is the encoding and JFIF is the file format. JPEG is well documented and well supported. JPEG 1.02 is considered an acceptable format as per NARA Transfer Guidance.
Preferred Processing and Transformation: Adobe Photoshop; GNU Image Manipulation Program; IrfanView

Description and Justification: Often referred to as "JPEG," however JPEG is the encoding and JFIF is the file format. The JPEG File Interchange Format is well documented and well supported.
Preferred Processing and Transformation: Adobe Photoshop; GNU Image Manipulation Program; IrfanView

Description and Justification: JPEG is well documented and well supported. JTIP is a multi-resolution format, created for image presentation and allows presentation of images in various sizes and resolutions. JTIP is not widely used and is no longer supported.
Preferred Processing and Transformation: Adobe Photoshop; GNU Image Manipulation Program; IrfanView

Notes: A number of JPEGs in NARA's holdings have only been identified by their extensions. NF00641 is currently a catch-all for these.
Description and Justification: Often referred to as "JPEG," however JPEG is the encoding and JFIF is the file format. The JPEG File Interchange Format is well documented and well supported.
Preferred Processing and Transformation: Adobe Photoshop; GNU Image Manipulation Program; IrfanView

Description and Justification: JPEG XL is an ISO standard format that is optimized for web environment delivery, storing both JPEG and JPEG XL codestreams using lossless or lossy compression to create significantly smaller files that a standard JPEG.
Preferred Processing and Transformation: ImageMagick. Chrome supported, but then removed the ability to render JPEG XL natively.

Description and Justification: TIFF is well documented and well supported. TIFF versions 4-6 are considered preferred formats as per NARA Transfer Guidance.
Preferred Processing and Transformation: Adobe Photoshop; IrfanView; GNU Image Manipulation program

Format Name: Tagged Image File Format (TIFF) unspecified version
Notes: A number of TIFFs in NARA's holdings have only been identified by their extensions. NF00762 is currently a catch-all for these.
Proposed Preservation Plan: Depends on version, retain TIFF 1-6, otherwise see specific version plan
Description and Justification: TIFF is well documented and well supported. TIFF versions 4-6 are considered preferred formats as per NARA Transfer Guidance.
Preferred Processing and Transformation: Adobe Photoshop; IrfanView; GNU Image Manipulation program

Format Name: Tagged Image File Format for Electronic Photography (TIFF/EP)
Proposed Preservation Plan: Further research is required, possibly transform to TIFF 6.0 or DNG
Description and Justification: TIFF/EP may not be read by all readers or editors, and some color management may be lost. TIFF/EP is a subtype of TIFF 6.0, but conversion should be considered on a case-by-case basis. For camera RAW files, conversion to DNG may be appropriate.
Preferred Processing and Transformation: Adobe Photoshop; IrfanView; GNU Image Manipulation program

Format Name: Tagged Image File Format for Image Technology (TIFF/IT)
Proposed Preservation Plan: Further research is required, possibly transform to TIFF 6.0
Description and Justification: TIFF/IT may not be read by all readers or editors, and some color management may be lost. TIFF/IT is a subtype of TIFF 6.0, but conversion to TIFF should be considered on a case-by-case basis.
Preferred Processing and Transformation: Adobe Photoshop; IrfanView; GNU Image Manipulation program

Format Name: Tagged Image File Format for Internet Fax (TIFF-FX)
Proposed Preservation Plan: Further research is required, possibly transform to TIFF 6.0
Description and Justification: Also known as Fax Extended. TIFF-FX may not be read by all readers or editors, and some color management may be lost. TIFF-FX is a subtype of TIFF 6.0, but conversion to TIFF should be considered on a case-by-case basis.
Preferred Processing and Transformation: Adobe Photoshop; IrfanView; GNU Image Manipulation program

Description and Justification: The file format (extension PCMWAVEFORMAT) is well documented and there are open source tools available for transcoding.
The file format (extension WAVEFORMATEX) is well documented and there are open source tools available for transcoding.

Format Name: Waveform Audio File Format (WAVE) with LPCM Audio
Description and Justification: Wave Waveform Audio File (wave, .WAV) is considered an acceptable format as per NARA Transfer Guidance, however, the specific codec (LPCM audio) is not required as part of the format Transfer Guidance. The file format is well documented and there are open source tools available for transcoding.

OBJ is a geometry definition file format first developed by Wavefront Technologies for its Advanced Visualizer animation package. The file format is open and has been adopted by other 3D graphics application vendors. The .obj extension is for the ASCII version, while .mod is a proprietary, binary format. Wavefront 3.0 was jointly released as Alias Wavefront and Maya.

The Web ARChive (WARC) is a container archive format that specifies a method for combining multiple digital resources into an aggregate archive file together with related information. WARC is an ISO standard (ISO 28500:2017) in use by the international web archiving community. Web archives in general should never be migrated, as that would change the fundamental linkages and functionality of web objects.
Preferred Processing and Transformation: pyweb or OpenWayback for the processing of the WARC contents
